sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>bird</radical> radical and the <kanji>bird</kanji> kanji are the same!
meaningInfo: As long as you know the radical bird you know the kanji bird.
readingMnemonic: Think of a run of the mill <kanji>bird</kanji>, whatever comes to mind for you first is fine. Then, your lovely bird swells. The shape of a face, then a hand, start stretching the bird apart until it explodes outward. Covered in blood and feathers is Mrs. <reading>Chou</reading> (<ja>ちょう</ja>).
readingInfo: After bursting out of this bird, she turns her head sharply in your direction. "I don't just own the streets, I own the birds too. I'm inside every bird, and I, Mrs Chou, can burst out at any time.
